title: Niccolò Machiavelli
summary: Niccolò di Bernardo dei Machiavelli (/ˌmækiəˈvɛli/; Italian: [nikkoˈlɔ mmakjaˈvɛlli]; 3 May 1469 – 21 June 1527) was an Italian diplomat, author, philosopher, and  historian who lived during the Renaissance. He is best known for his political treatise The Prince (Il Principe), written about 1513.[5] He has often been called the father of modern political philosophy and political science.[6]
